description: From Middle English blakebird, blacbrid (“ouzel; Eurasian blackbird”), equivalent to black +‎ bird.

entries.meaning: A common true thrush, Turdus merula, found in woods and gardens over much of Eurasia, and introduced elsewhere.
A variety of New World birds of the family Icteridae (26 species of icterid bird).
(slang, derogatory, historical, among slavers and pirates) A native of the South Pacific islands.

verbs.description: blackbird (third-person singular simple present blackbirds, present participle blackbirding, simple past and past participle blackbirded)

entries.meaning: To enslave someone, especially through chicanery or force
